body: There are no test case in this plugin
We need integration test case here, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases
Yes. Today, we don't recommend set uuid manually.
Wh you submit codes into my branch?
No, you can't. There are many types of metrics there.
The test case is required here, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases

> The test case is required here, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases

yes, i am doing that.
sorry,I'm not find which branch could I submit ,it's my first PR;
I will merge my branch soon, so this is not a big issue. In SkyWalking, the master branch is the branch you contributed.
Fixed.
Closing this because of no further update.
Fixed in 6.3.0

Please check supported list.

@candyleer please take a look.

@chenwr do you recheck latest release? 6.3.0 or master.

Your target branch is still wrong. And your ci fails.
Please fix.
I have completed a v-2 plugin that has been used in the test environment. I may consider submitting it in the future
@stalary Welcome the contributions. We are closing to 6.4.0 release, if you want, please consider to submit pull request before that.
Please fix CI and conflicts.

> @stalary Welcome the contributions. We are closing to 6.4.0 release, if you want, please consider to submit pull request before that.

Ok, I will submit it as soon as possible
FYI @BFergerson
The right one to avoid this, is to set length limit at operation name at agent side. Otherwise, it is too complex. Are you interested in contributing this?
I encountered this problem because base64 was passed in the request, and I haven't found out which plugin caused it, and I've been trying to fix it recently

We don't need to find this out. Because this is mostly because of length of endpoint/operationName. We could change core APIs(ContextManager#createXXXSpan), make sure the operation name is not too long.

Do you get my point?
There are a lot of appenders there. We have given your the typical examples, you should be able to do a new one, and contribute to the community.
ok, I’ve got it, I will resolve it.
Looking forward you are the 150th contributor of our main repo.
/run e2e
@wu-sheng, thanks for keeping me updated. @wentjiang, let me know if I can be of any assistance with the integration tests.
Resolve #3233
/run ci
Check the appplication toolkit, there is an annotation(in a toolkit lib) for this. You don't need to develop plugin.

@wu-sheng keep calm , wu . i am just reporting the issue here in case you  want to figure it out in your latest public release. I don't think we could assume every user of SkyWalking could be a easy contributor for SkyWalking, which requires lots of skills and background. And as the kind users, we are doing the best for sumit the possible bug for this specific open source project. We are just trying to do the same great as what you genius contributors do. Thanks.
@wu-sheng Can you help me look over this problem
Please try the latest release. This NPE is not known by me. It looks like someone set a null to hostname.
What happen?

> > @wu-sheng I need more logs that help recheck. Could you provided more logs?
> 
> What kind of log do you need except the [validate log](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/246/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-26-15-51.log)? I think that's all we have. The validate log shows that there is no expected spans/endpoints

validate log is not enough. Could you provided test case execution and agent logs?
namespace is designed for isolation two SkyWalking environment. You are talking about tenancy, do don't have that today.

> validate log is not enough. Could you provided test case execution and agent logs?

We are running the same codes as you did. Just using parallel mode.
You are running optional plugin, have you open that in test case?
Check this, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/blob/master/gateway-scenario/testcase.yml#L17
@wu-sheng Thanks very much. I was fixed running mode in test case. Could you run tests again?

> @wu-sheng Thanks very much. I was fixed running mode in test case. Could you run tests again?

But why test cases passed in my local when running mode is default?
There is no Dubbo 4 according to release note. https://github.com/apache/dubbo/releases

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/aiyanbo/testReport-play-plugin-2019-08-28-11-45.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/251/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-28-11-45.log)
Why is it ok for me to use `./mvnw package -Pagent,dist` compilation locally，But travis-ci can't pass
Travis is not stable, ignore it. `CI` and `e2e` are keys.

I also cant package skywalking-ui,  same error as @antoni-g . 
then i uninstall npm and nodejs on my windows. 
it have a differrent error.

If you want, propose an issue about how to do it, we could discuss it on there.
Link to your test case pull request at here, and post your local test result please. And you need to update `Supported-list.md`.

> If you want, propose an issue about how to do it, we could discuss it on there.

I found that for independently launched service programs, as long as the agent.service_name of agent.config is configured, the name displayed on skywalking UI can be configured, but when it comes to mysql, skywalking seems to automatically take the host name of datasource.url as the name.I'm just asking if there's a way like zipkin probe to put parameters in the url of mysql configuration,such as "?Servicename =mydbname" set custom name, displayed on skywaling's UI instead

I tried with v6.3.0 and latest master (v6.4.0-SNAPSHOT) ,the issue still exists . the root cause should be the way we are using bytebuddy that generate the final method . if can find another way without final method generated should resolve .
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9836134/63829724-deb51000-c99c-11e9-8891-cdd83ff7fe75.png)
This issue has little to do with the version of dubbo.
Your network issue. Nothing more. Package has been rechecked every commit merging.
No such mechanism. Protocol is compatible in all 6.x versions, you could update when you need reboot the applications.
@chenwr This is the root cause, but your suggestion is not the solution. The right one is adding a fix plugin to Spring core, ignore the generated method.

We are not asking change to the target application. What Zipkin did, it is Zipkin choice, I am asking that, if you want to SkyWalking supports the rename, you need to submit the why to implement, rather than a simple idea. No one is working or asked that before, you are the first. Unless you start taking actions, I am afraid you have to wait anyone wants to do that.
/run ci
Read FAQ or storage setup document. It is there already.
/run ci
Did you compile according to the compilation guide
That is maven thing. Not skywalking thing.

@wuxingye if you want to compile a single module of SkyWalking project, please follow the [documentation](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md#advanced-compile), double check the documentation next time before submitting an issue :)

the skywalking ui
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9107702/63858468-19886980-c9d8-11e9-96fc-2bdde2ba0ed6.png)

the logback-spring.xml file

```xml
<appender name="stash" class="net.logstash.logback.appender.LogstashTcpSocketAppender">
    <destination>${destination}</destination>
    <connectionStrategy>
        <roundRobin>
            <connectionTTL>5 seconds</connectionTTL>
        </roundRobin>
    </connectionStrategy>
    <reconnectionDelay>1 second</reconnectionDelay>
    <encoder charset="UTF-8" class="net.logstash.logback.encoder.LogstashEncoder">
        <provider class="org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.logstash.TraceIdJsonProvider">
        </provider>
        <customFields>{"app_id":"${app_id}"}</customFields>
    </encoder>
</appender>
```

the maven dependency

```xml
            <dependency>
                <groupId>org.apache.skywalking</groupId>
                <artifactId>apm-toolkit-logback-1.x</artifactId>
                <version>${skywalking.version}</version>
            </dependency>
```

@wuxingye if possible, I think you can upload your test project to a GitHub repository instead of posting code snippets here, which should be more friendly to reviewers and we can verify your changes more easily
I'll do the rest of the work tomorrow, thank you
@zhaoyuguang Please run the tests in our INFRA.
